div.div: Τληπόλεμος : (1) a son of Hercules and Astyoche, who as a fugitive found safety in Rhodes, and became king there, Il. 2.653, 657, 661, Il. 5.628, 631, 632, 648, 656, 660, 668.—(2) a Lycian, son of Damastor, slain by Patroclus, Il. 16.416.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
